name: Halcyon Cove by Rex Resorts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From arriving, yes the reception staff were very polite & helpful. Great to receive a cold towel and a fruit punch cocktail whilst checking in. Room was big and spacious, but yeah a bit worn around the edges, but how much time do you spend in your room. Pool was clean with sun loungers around it, plenty of sun loungers on the beach, but beware....the towel gestapo were in full force on putting towels on sun beds at yes 06:30hrs ....I thought I could beat them at 0700hrs but no. This was the English doing this and many didn't turn up till midday or not at all. Shade was precious, specially at midday. I have been to a couple of hotels were you have to check your towels in and out daily and they assign you a sunbed and mark it on a plan...maybe this could be adopted by the Halycon Cove...?
reviews.title: Pure Relaxation.........Bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good, with a good choice for everyone. The staff were great, nothing was too much trouble for any of them. Bar staff crazy.......especially Errol the Arsenal supporter (see you got a mention) and the Entertainmant staff out of this world Fenton & Charm. We dined one night on the Warri Pier, where you can choose off the all inclusive menu (which is highlighted with a star) or you can pay extra for anything off the main menu, which we found not too costly. Book the Warri Pier as you arrive as some nights it is not open, we wished we had time for a second dining on there,but no bookings left...
reviews.title: Abundantly Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were cleaned to a very high standard.
reviews.title: A proper holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The atmosphere was chilled and relaxing, the staff work very hard to make you happy.
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were some moans about the mosquito's and sand flies, we took high protective deet away with us and wore mosquito bands and weren't affected. They do fog the grounds with a deterent twice a week,just to keep the buggers down.
reviews.title: This is what holidays are about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife and I have been to this hotel many times over the years and returned again recently with 5 friends . On leaving we all agreed it to be one of our best holidays .
reviews.title: Once again a wonderful holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great flight with Virgin and made to feel most welcome on our arrival .Lovely Poolside rooms and soon we were enjoying great hospitality from staff wherever we went .We felt there were several areas of improvement since our last visit .The food more varied and presented better and the evening entertainment was much improved .
reviews.title: A great stay at Halcyon Cove

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful staff as always , special mention to our great friend Debbie also Roxanne ,Errol ,Helena ,Fenton and Charm also Devon and Mario and of course many more and not forgetting the Boss man Richard who was always available to help and advise .
reviews.title: Antiguan Smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had two lovely meals on the Warri Pier again with excellent service . Also we had two invites to Cocktail Parties which again we enjoyed .
reviews.title: Excellent Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel provides excellent value for money and we should remember it is 3 star and everything may not be perfect .
reviews.title: Great value resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what a great carribean mood! I never left any place as relaxed as I did after my stay there. Super beach, stunning water colours, carribean fresh food and they can make you a burger if you want to! :-) In all inclusive the drinks are included which made it easier to chill out! The staff are great and extremely helpful. Entertainment was great as we even had an amazing classical concert there on one of the evenings! Thoroughly recommended!
reviews.title: pleasantly suprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful vacation. Antigua is a beautiful island and there is a lot to do. Beach is beautiful, nice white soft sand. There are sand flies however and some people were bitten badly. The resort is a three star resort!!!!! Rooms are very basic but clean. Food is very good but very basic as well........but It's better than some other islands even in more star resorts. Entertainment is almost non existent. There is three girls singing one night, karaokee the next.........boring.........Trips are great. We took a trip to Barbuda by a speed boat and trip aroun Antigua island. Very nice and worth to do. Overall, Antigua is a beautiful island and I will definitely go again.
reviews.title: Beautiful Island of Antigua

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't stay here for a standard international hotel experience. You can probably get that next door at Sandals for 4 times the price. Halcyon Cove is a lovely Carribean experience on one of the best beaches on the island. The staff are fantastic - very friendly and very natural. Be careful, a lot have a very dry sense of humour so don't expect deference. These guys have a warm charm and are just as likely to take the mick as put their arms around you and give you a hug. Entertainment every night - each member of staff seems to have 3 jobs and loads of smiles.
reviews.title: Great stay if you like to experience natural Carribean charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food is good but can be a bit repetitive. Very clean
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: A three star hotel situated on a beautiful beach on the West side of Antigua it provides good value for money when on an all inclusive tariff. My wife and I spent a very happy week there enjoying the sunshine away from the European Winter.
reviews.title: Great Location but hire a car!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at Halcyon Cove Antigua for one week in February, and had a fantastic time. It was a great overall resort, clean and friendly staff. All rooms were just steps away from everything including the beach.
reviews.title: Great, relaxing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Our room was 357 in the garden building and we had an amazing view of the ocean from our balcony. It was on the second (top) floor. There are quite a few stairs to walk up, so just a warning to anyone who might not like this. We actually found it good exercise for both of us throughout the week. The room was spacious with a king bed, great working fridge, terrific a/c, and a wall-mounted flat screen tv with tons of channels. Wifi in the room was pretty good for the most part, although sometimes we had to move onto the balcony to get a signal.
reviews.title: Nice beach, but the vendors ruined it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Food in the Arawack (buffet) was pretty good, and varied every day, although the buffet spread was small, and wait times for grill items were sometimes long and slow. A huge disappointment was the coffee at breakfast (coming from two people from the land of Starbucks and Tim Hortons).
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Warri Pier restaurant was gorgeous and the staff there were fantastic. Dinner portions were small and food was average. Just a warning about mosquitoes in the evening there though (to be expected since the restaurant is on the water and is open air). Quite worth the experience though.
reviews.title: Great hotel, shame about the sand flies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was beautiful, although the water was fairly rough, cool and murky most of the week. No snorkeling possible, but I don't think there were any fish in this area anyway. We had no issues with sand flies on the beach or by the pool, as some of the other travelers experienced, and we never even used any insect repellant at all. We only sat by the pool one day (on the grassy part) but never had problems with bugs here either. Can't figure that one out as this seems to be a common complaint with other reviewers. (Management: please please please get some new pool loungers!)
reviews.title: beware sand flies that BITE

aka: Halcyon Cove By Rex Hotel St. John`s
